message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to discuss the sale of our product with you. I believe it's a game-changer and I'm confident you'll love it. As we start our negotiation, I'm willing to offer you the product for $1,300,000. This is a great starting point, and I'm open to discussing further to find a mutually beneficial agreement.

Thanks for the offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  While I see the value in your product, $1,300,000 is still a bit above my budget.  I'm prepared to pay $1,250,000. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the value of the product while staying within my spending limit.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand your budget constraints, but I'm still confident that our product is worth more than $1,250,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product for $1,275,000. This is a compromise that I believe reflects the value of the product while still being reasonable. Let me know if this is something you'd be interested in.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise. While $1,275,000 is closer to my budget, I'm still unable to go that high.  I'm sticking with my previous offer of $1,250,000.  This is a fair price that reflects the value of your product while staying within my financial limits. I'm hoping we can reach an agreement on this price.

I understand that you're still hesitant to go above $1,250,000, Bob. However, I want to emphasize that our product is a unique opportunity that can bring significant value to your business. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer the product for $1,260,000. This is as close as I can get to your budget while still ensuring I get a fair price for the product. Let me know if this is something you'd be willing to consider.
